name: market for ozone, liquid | ozone, liquid | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11889/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'ozone, liquid', in the geography of Europe.;Special transport modelling for liquid gases: No ship transport and normal transport modelling for chemicals reduced by 90%.;;'ozone, liquid'  is an inorganic substance with a CAS no. : 010028-15-6. It is called 'trioxygen' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: O3. It is gas and has a pungent odour. The substance is modelled as a pure substance. On a consumer level, is used in the following products: air care products, biocides (e.g. disinfectants, pest control products), laboratory chemicals, paper chemicals and dyes and water treatment chemicals. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: chemicals.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'ozone, liquid',  within the geography of Europe.

This activity ends with the supply of 'ozone, liquid',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics.

Reduced from the average estimation for chemicals by 90% for transport of liquid gases.

exchanges.description:
Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

Reduced from the average estimation for chemicals by 90% for transport of liquid gases.
